Template: I constructively approach new and unexpected events or announcements.
I am open to work on the tasks not entirely related to my position.
I aim to create a positive working environment around myself.
I react constructively after making a mistake.
I communicate ideas well verbally.
I don't have misunderstandings with my teammates.
I communicate ideas well in writing.
I am open to learn new things and expand my professional expertise.
I have knowledge and experience that goes beyond my job responsibilities, i.e., tools, methodologies, frameworks.
I achieve my objectives and goals.
I follow team standards and processes.
I pay attention to detail.
I am proactive in suggesting solutions and improvements, i.e., code quality, process, etc.
I take fast and informed decisions.My teammates trust the choices that I make.
I constructively handle (critical) feedback.
I provide constructive feedback to individual teammates and the team.
I value contributions and opinions of other teammates.
I am well organized.
I can organize teamwork.
I am a productive employee.
I keep personal involvement high and support the team when the project gets delayed or stuck.
I always finish my initiatives.
I set clear and measurable goals for myself.
I use means at my disposal (conferences, books, webinars) for continuous self-improvement.
I offer support to the other team members when needed.
I am a team player.
I collaborate and build a relationship with the team.
I possess all required (tech.) skills for doing my job.
I can teach to other teammates in some/any technical discipline.
This is what my team or individual teammates have learned from me
This is what I still could learn from my team
